title: DSP (Direct Support Professional) M-F 9am-1pm. Brooklyn, 11217.
description:
**This is a M-F 9am-1pm position. 20 hours total. Wheelchair bound is not verbal. Needs to be changed when soiled.**

Our Center is seeking an experienced support professional who has chosen this field because they are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through a career in health or mental care.

You have at least a high school degree with experience in direct and active support of people with autism, down's syndrome, etc. or even better, a bachelor's degree in a field related to health and mental care: psychology, special education, mental health, behavioral science, etc. We offer competitive pay and benefits in a fast-growing, start-up-like environment where the right combination of independent, creative thinking and enthusiastic teamwork will guarantee career growth.

You will be responsible for supporting our program participant.

**Provide Safety & Support**

* Ensure health, safety and welfare of client with developmental disabilities.
* Safeguard and respect the confidentiality of the individual and their family.
* Promote individual's independence.
* Assist to develop and maintain relationships.
* Promote and protect the health, safety and emotional well-being of the client.
* Commit to person-centered supports and honor the personality, preferences, culture and strengths of the client.
* Work in partnership with client to support to lead self-directed lives.
* Implement and adhere to established actionable plans.
* Ability to communicate effectively.
* Be able to establish rapport and communicate positively with parents.
* Provide information to parents about behaviors and interactions with the child.

**Administrative & Company Policies**

* Commitment to company values and adherence to policies.
* Uphold the standards set by the National Alliance for Direct Support Professionals (NADSP) Code of Ethics.
* Be familiar with fire evacuation and emergency procedures within the home and community environments.
* Maintain all required certifications.
* May be required to report to alternate work location (job-coaching can take place anywhere in the community, within 10 miles)
* Report problems and concerns to supervisors immediately
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management

**Education/Qualifications**

* High school diploma required, bachelors or masters preferred.
* Experience working with medically fragile people and with people with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
* Valid driver’s license and impeccable driving record.
* Willingness to provide personal care.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to change client when soiled?
* Are you available to work M-F 9am-1pm in Brooklyn? What is your availability?
* Do you have experience with wheelchair bound/non-verbal clients?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Special needs caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)
* CPR Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: After School Cheer Instructor
description:
\\*Overview\\*

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic cheer instructor to join our team. If you have a passion for helping students learn the basics of cheerleading and enjoy working in an educational setting, this position is perfect for you. Position is for once a week on Mondays after school and the class runs for 8 weeks.

\\*Duties\\*

- Provide group afterschool instructual cheer classes for 8 weeks to students in Grades K-5

- Develop material to be taught and include team building games or activites

- be there 15 minutes before class to meet site director and gather students

- assist with dismissal of students

- keep weekly attendance logs to be turned in

- Maintain a positive and encouraging learning environment

\\*Requirements\\*

- Experience working with children in educational or recreational settings

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills

- Ability to adapt teaching strategies to meet individual student needs

- Background in childcare, daycare, sports coaching, or special education is a plus

- First aid certification is desirable but not mandatory

title: Print Shop Manager/ Content Creator
description:
**Location:** Graphic Garage

1517 US Highway 46 E

Parsippany NJ 07054

**Job Type:** Full-Time Print Shop Manager/ Social Media Content Creator

**Job Summary:**  
Print Shop Manager/ Social media content creator will be responsible for , executing, and closing projects according to deadlines and within budget. This role involves coordinating with various clients, managing resources, and ensuring that project objectives are met while adhering to quality standards.

Managing the daily operations of the print shop, including overseeing staff, ensuring quality control, managing production schedules, and maintaining equipment. This role requires strong leadership skills, a keen eye for detail, and a solid understanding of printing processes and technologies.

Developing, curating, and managing engaging content across our social media channels. This role requires a strong understanding of social media trends, audience engagement, and brand storytelling to effectively communicate our message and connect with our audience.

**Key Responsibilities:**  
- Oversee the daily operations of the print shop, ensuring efficient workflow and timely completion of projects.  
- Manage and supervise print shop staff, including hiring, training, and performance evaluations.  
- Develop and implement production schedules to meet customer deadlines and optimize resource allocation.  
- Ensure quality control standards are met throughout the printing process, from pre-press to final output.  
- Maintain and troubleshoot printing equipment, coordinating repairs and maintenance as needed.  
- Collaborate with sales and customer service teams to understand client needs and provide solutions.  
- Monitor inventory levels of printing supplies and materials, placing orders as necessary.  
- Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices to enhance shop operations.  
- Create and publish high-quality, engaging content (text, images, videos) tailored to each social media platform (e.g., Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok).  
- Develop and implement a content calendar that aligns with marketing strategies and promotional campaigns.  
- Monitor social media trends, tools, and best practices to ensure content is relevant and impactful.  
- Collaborate with the marketing team to align social media content with overall brand messaging and goals.  
- Engage with followers, respond to comments and messages, and foster a sense of community on our social media channels.  
- Analyze social media performance metrics and provide insights to optimize content strategy.  
- Stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for growth and innovation.

**Qualifications:**  
- Proven experience as a social media content creator or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work.  
- Excellent writing, editing, and communication skills.  
- Proficiency in graphic design and video editing tools (e.g., Adobe Illustrator, Canva).  
- Strong understanding of social media platforms, algorithms, and best practices.  
- Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative ideas and concepts.  
- Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment

- 4 years of experience in a print shop or similar environment, with a proven track record in management.  
- Strong knowledge of printing processes, equipment, and materials.  
- Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.  
- Proficiency in print production software and tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, print management systems).  
- Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

**What We Offer:**  
- Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Parsippany-Troy Hills, NJ 07054 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Parsippany-Troy Hills, NJ 07054: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Special Inspector Master
description:
**SUMMARY:** 

Join Our Team as a **Special Inspector** for **immediate** Building, Transportation, & Infrastructure Projects! This role will initially support projects in New York City.

Are you ready to take on dynamic challenges in the heart of New York City's construction landscape? We are currently seeking driven and qualified Special Inspectors to join our team for immediate project needs.

**QUALIFICATIONS:** 

:

* Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Mechanical or Structural Engineering or Architecture
* 3+ years’ experience inspecting construction work in the city of NY, varied in Size and complexity.
* Familiarity with Chapter 17 of the NYC Building Code

:

* Currently holds a valid certification in **any or all** of the following:
* **AWS Certified Welding Inspector or ICC Structural Welding Inspector**
* **ICC Structural Steel and Bolting Inspector**
* **ICC Concrete Special Inspector**
* **ICC Masonry Special Inspector**
* **Master Special Inspector**
* Current training in crucial safety protocols, including fall protection, scaffolding and ladders, work-zone safety,.
* Minimum of 10-hour OSHA construction safety certification.

:

* Ability to effectively communicate with colleagues and clients at all organizational levels
* Proficiency in utilizing Microsoft Office Suite for documentation and reporting purposes
* Demonstrated ability to deliver inspection reports promptly and accurately
* Possession of a reliable mode of transportation and a valid driver’s license
* Willingness to pursue additional certifications to enhance professional skills and expertise
* Aptitude for collaborative teamwork as well as the ability to work independently when necessary
* Familiarity with relevant construction industry codes and regulations

**Here's a breakdown of what we provide:**

**Hourly Rate: $45 - $60**

Location: New York City, NY

Annual Incentive Bonus Plan

Pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and market location.

Our Health and Welfare Benefits are designed to meet your needs, with eligibility starting on your first day of employment:

Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage

Company-matched Retirement plan

Generous Paid Time Off and Company Holidays

Life Insurance and AD&D coverage

Short-Term Disability (STD) and Long-Term Disability (LTD)

Optional life and pet insurance

EAP and Total Wellbeing Lifestyle Programs

Tuition Assistance and/or Professional Development

Employee Discounts

This information is transparently provided in adherence to several state and local Equal Pay and Pay Transparency Laws.

Join us at Bureau Veritas, where your well-being and professional growth are our top priorities.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.00 - $60.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* AD&D insurance
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule

* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid jury duty
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance
* Wellness program

Schedule:

* Day shift

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP)
description:
**We provide help, create hope, and preserve dignity.**

As one of the largest human services agencies in New York, we offer a variety of programs and services addressing child welfare, family support, developmental disabilities, immigration, and mental health needs.

A Day in the Life of a DSP - video

https://youtu.be/cnK4z3KAqtE

Salary: $16.00 - $18.00/hour based on differentials

Job Title: Direct Support Professional DSP

Program: Developmental Disabilities

Location: Queens and Staten Island

Shifts: All shifts available days, evenings, overnights, weekends, full time, per diem

www.catholicguardian.org

***Apply now to attend a virtual info session and then an in-person interview***

General Responsibilities:

Under the supervision of the residence manager and the clinical team, the Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for the direct care and personal development of each person assigned who lives in a Catholic Guardian Services (CGS) residence. Interactions and supports are to be carried out in a manner that creates a homelike atmosphere and fosters learning, dignity and respect.

Essential Job Functions

* Assists each person to overcome barriers and challenges to establish and maintain a network of community-based relationships and valued social roles
* Protects health, safety and well-being of each person served to the fullest extent possible, in accordance with the plan of care.
* Supports each person with dignity and respect and teaches skills in adaptive behavior, activities of daily living, development of self-help and social skills and which foster greater independence and self-direction.
* Carries out all interventions, procedures and notifications, including but not limited to medical, behavioral and nursing, in accordance with the service plan, agency requirements and OPWDD regulations
* Carries out meal purchasing, planning, preparation and implementation in accordance with each person’s dietary needs and doctor’s order’s.
* Performs housekeeping, cooking, laundry, light maintenance and light preventative maintenance duties as needed to maintain a clean, personalized, safe and homelike environment.

Requirements:

HS Diploma/GED, 1 year related personal care experience. Ability to cover shifts as needed

Preferred (but not required)

Drivers’ license (differential), RNA (differential), AMAP (differential), Shift Supervisor (differential)

What do you bring to the table:

You are empathetic, kind and a natural nurturer. You enjoy supporting adults achieve goals. You believe in our mission and are committed to being a part of our journey towards Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion for both staff and those who participate in our programs.

What do we bring to the table:

Union 888 Health Insurance, personal holidays, vacation, sick, personal days, 403b retirement plan, training/job development and growth opportunities, Tuition Reimbursement, Student Loan Repayment, Life Insurance, STD/LTD, AD&D Insurance, AFLAC, Pet Insurance, a robust Employee Assistance Program with over 8,000 free training classes and additional support, a commitment to Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion thru our JEDI Steering Committee, Credit Union, Tickets At Work, Flexible Spending Accounts – Health/Commuter/Dependent Care

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Overnight shift
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* DSP: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)
* Night Shift (Preferred)
* Overnight Shift (Preferred)

title: Real Estate Buyer's Agent Specialist
description:
Are you determined to help buyers find the home of their dreams? We’re looking for a knowledgeable and enthusiastic buyer’s agent to join our team. You’ll act as the buyer’s main point of contact from the first message to the final sale and ensure they have a positive experience with us. If you’re looking for a position with exponential earning and growth opportunities, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

* Create documents such as representation contracts, purchase agreements, closing statements, deeds, and leases to close the sale
* Provide potential home buyers with pertinent information about their local housing market
* Make sure buyers clients go through a seamless home purchasing process including helping buyers choose mortgage options that fit their budget
* Serve as an intermediary between the buyer and seller or listing agent to ensure mutual transaction satisfaction
* Contact and follow-up with pre-qualified leads to assess their wants and needs in a home

Qualifications:

Licensed or willingness to pursue a Real Estate License

Valid U.S. driver’s license with the ability to travel by car

Sufficient knowledge of the local real estate market and recent trends

title: Case Aide (bi-lingual)
description:
**Bilingual Case Aide** [I'RAISE + ACS]

**Title**: Case Aide / Peer Support

**Classification**: Non-Exempt

**Status**: Full-time

**Salary**: $42,000

**Location:** North Bronx, NY but able to commute to any borough in NYC

**Supervisor**: Case Planner Supervisor

**Hire Date:** Hiring immediately - start date of Mid-October 2024

**Job Requirement:** *Highly preferred if Bilingual Spanish Speaking, have experience working in Human Service/Social Service Field; 1+ years of relevant Case Aide experience*

**I’RAISE + ACS:** 

I’RAISE is partnering with the Administration for Children’s Services (ACS) using the School-Based-Early Support model. The goal is to partner closely with schools to connect families to support and services well before concerns warrant a call to the Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment (SCR). ACS, through I’RAISE, intends to offer families “light touch” service options that strive to connect families to community resources through case management, address families’ concrete needs, support parent/caregiver capacity in their caregiving roles, and avoid unnecessary investigations.

**Position Summary**:

The **Full-time Case Aide** will provide essential casework support to case planning staff, assist families with concrete needs, and provide overall support for school outreach efforts, community-driven offerings, and other aspects of service delivery. Under the supervision of the Case Planner Supervisor, the Case Aide / Peer Support will work closely with families, school staff, and community partners to ensure the successful implementation of the School-Based Early Support program.

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for providing additional casework support (1 per supervisor)
* Provide casework support to case planning staff, including assistance with documentation, referrals, and follow-up with families
* Assist families with concrete needs, such as accessing food, housing, healthcare, and other essential services
* Support school outreach efforts, including attending meetings, events, and workshops as needed
* Collaborate with community partners to identify resources and opportunities for families
* Participate in team meetings, trainings, and professional development activities
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of interactions with families and service providers
* Provide peer support to families, offering empathy, encouragement, and practical assistance
* Assist with the coordination of special events, projects, and initiatives to support program goals
* Perform other duties as assigned by the Case Planner Supervisor

**Qualifications / Requirements**:

* Highly preferred if bilingual spanish and english speaking
* One year of relevant work in child welfare or social services or life experience; **OR**
* Successful completion of an Administration for Children’s Services-funded prevention services program or similar program; **OR**
* A high school diploma or equivalent.
* Experience working with children, families, and communities in a supportive capacity
* Knowledge of child welfare and family support services in New York City
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team and independently
* Proficiency in Google Suite and case management software preferred

**Travel Requirement**:

* Ability to travel within New York City public schools to perform job-based duties
* Must be a New York City Resident with a valid Social Security Number - *I’RAISE does not provide relocation assistance nor provide any visa sponsorship at this time*

**Full-Time Employee Benefits**:

* Paid-time off (PTO):
* Vacation: 10 days for 1st & 2nd year, 14 days for 3rd year, 20 days for 4th year and onward, 6 days personal, 6 days sick, holidays, etc. Mental health days (1 day per month)
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits
* Retirement Plan - Matching
* Worker Compensation
* Disability Benefit
* Professional Development Small Tuition Reimbursement
* Loan Forgiveness - We are a qualified employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. To read about eligibility requirements visit https://studentaid.gov/manage-loans/forgiveness-cancellation/public-service
* Any added employee benefit

**Must complete background check requirements:** 

* Comprehensive Background Clearance Requirement
* Reference Checking
* Previous Employment Verification
* SCR Clearance
* SEL List Check
* Department of Education (DOE) Fingerprint Clearance

**TO APPLY & FOR MORE INFORMATION**

**Visit** 

**Complete the Job Application Form** 

***About IRAISE***

*I'RAISE Girls & Boys International Corporation is a heartfelt haven founded in 2012 by the visionary Chief Executive Officer, Shanequa Moore. As a beacon of hope and resilience, we stand tall as a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, proudly led by individuals from BIPOC and women communities. Since our inception, we have woven a tapestry of support, dedication, and transformation that defines who we are.*

*I’RAISE is not just an organization; it is a promise to make a difference in the lives of families. We are the guardians of youth, catalysts for community restoration, and architects of improved quality of life for minority children and families. Our purpose is etched in the very fabric of our holistic programs that commit to the well-being and empowerment of every child.*

*RAISE, EMPOWER, AND INSPIRE EVERY CHILD is not just a mantra; it's our guiding vision since 2012. We aspire to elevate self-esteem and self-worth, ensuring that every child, irrespective of background, finds success and progress in all facets of life*

*Join us in this journey of compassion, empowerment, and transformation. Together, we can rewrite the narrative for every child, building a future where potential knows no bounds.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Loan forgiveness
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* What are your experience in the Child Welfare and Social Service area?
* Have you completed your fingerprint ($105) with the Department of Education (DOE) in NYC?
* What are your 1+ years of experiences as Case Aide?

Work Location: In person

title: Direct Support Professional. M-TH 7pm-9pm. EAST ELMHURST, NY. $17
description:
**This is a M-TH 7PM-9PM CASE. LOCATED IN EAST ELMHURST, NY.** 

Seeking an experienced support professional who has chosen this field because they are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through a career in health or mental care.

You have at least a high school degree with experience in direct and active support of people with autism, down's syndrome, etc. or even better, a bachelor's degree in a field related to health and mental care: psychology, special education, mental health, behavioral science, etc. We offer competitive pay and benefits in a fast-growing, start-up-like environment where the right combination of independent, creative thinking and enthusiastic teamwork will guarantee career growth.

You will be responsible for supporting our program participant.

**Provide Safety & Support**

* Ensure health, safety and welfare of client with developmental disabilities.
* Safeguard and respect the confidentiality of the individual and their family.
* Promote individual's independence.
* Assist to develop and maintain relationships.
* Promote and protect the health, safety and emotional well-being of the client.
* Commit to person-centered supports and honor the personality, preferences, culture and strengths of the client.
* Work in partnership with client to support to lead self-directed lives.
* Implement and adhere to established actionable plans.
* Ability to communicate effectively.
* Be able to establish rapport and communicate positively with parents.
* Provide information to parents about behaviors and interactions with the child.

**Administrative & Company Policies**

* Commitment to company values and adherence to policies.
* Uphold the standards set by the National Alliance for Direct Support Professionals (NADSP) Code of Ethics.
* Be familiar with fire evacuation and emergency procedures within the home and community environments.
* Maintain all required certifications.
* May be required to report to alternate work location (job-coaching can take place anywhere in the community, within 10 miles)
* Report problems and concerns to supervisors immediately
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management

**Education/Qualifications**

* High school diploma required, bachelors or masters preferred.
* Experience working with medically fragile people and with people with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
* Valid driver’s license and impeccable driving record.
* Willingness to provide personal care.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Are you available to work M-TH 7pm-9pm in East Elmhurst, Queens, NY?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Special needs caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)
* CPR Certification (Preferred)

title: Server/Bartender
description:
**Overview**

We are seeking skilled Bartenders & Servers to join our dynamic team in a busy restaurant environment.

As a member of our family, you will be responsible for creating memorable experiences for our guests while ensuring seamless service. If you are passionate about delivering exceptional customer service, and are comfortable working in a fast-paced setting, we encourage you to apply.

**Required Skills**

- Strong customer service skills.

- Ability to manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Experience with point-of-sale (POS) systems.

- Knowledge of the food industry, including food safety practices.

- Familiarity with restaurant operations and sales principles.

- Ability to handle cash and operate a cash register accurately.

- Willingness to help with other tasks as needed.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work in a team environment and maintain a positive attitude.

**Bartender Expectations:**

- Greet customers, take orders, and serve drinks and food in a friendly and efficient manner.

- Maintain a clean and organized bar area, including the bar, glassware, and utensils.

- Prepare and serve drinks according to the restaurant's cocktail menu and recipes.

- Handle cash and operate a point-of-sale (POS) system accurately and efficiently.

- Provide exceptional customer service by answering questions, making recommendations, and addressing concerns in a professional and courteous manner.

- Collaborate with other bartenders and restaurant staff to ensure smooth service and maintain high levels of quality and cleanliness.

- Assist with opening and closing procedures, including setting up the bar and counting cash and stock at the end of the shift.

- Maintain knowledge of menu items, including ingredients and preparation methods, to answer customer questions and provide recommendations.

- Participate in ongoing training to improve knowledge of drinks, wine, and spirits.

- Ensure compliance with food safety regulations and maintain a clean and hygienic work environment.

**Server Expecations:**

- Maintain a positive attitude at all times

- Excel in a team oriented setting

- Keep your cool in stressful situations

- Welcoming and greeting guests

- Taking customers’ food and drink orders - making appropriate recommendations to enhance their experience

- Collaborating with the kitchen and bar staff for prompt and correct delivery of orders

- Memorizing the menu and recommend appetizers, entrees and drinks

- Become familair with our wine list to make suggestions

- Delivering a memorable dining experience by resolving all customer issues promptly

- Assisting with the tidying of tables, clearing leftovers and keeping the dining area neat and pleasant

- Setting tables and rearranging the dining area to accommodate larger groups and prepare the restaurant for special events

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

* Food provided
* Paid training

* 10 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift

* Fine Dining: 2 years (Required)

title: Sales Representative
description:
**O’Shaughnessy Distilling Co.**

**Job Title:** Sales Representative

**Location:** Metro New York & New Jersey

**Markets include:** Metro New York & New Jersey

You must live in the metro New York area to be considered for this position

**SUMMARY:**

O’Shaughnessy Distilling Company, makers of award-winning Keeper's Heart whiskey, is a world-class distillery in Minneapolis, MN committed to creating exceptional whiskeys and meaningful experiences. As a forward-thinking company, established in 2019, we are at the forefront of the spirits industry, seeking driven and talented professionals to join our team. We believe in the power of community and collaboration to drive our success. Join us and contribute your expertise to help us build an exciting future in the world of spirits.

We’re seeking a Sales Representative reporting to the Senior Director of Sales. The Sales Representative is responsible for developing and growing the Keeper’s Heart Whiskey brand in key geographic areas.

**Responsibilities:**

· Increase visibility O’Shaughnessy Distilling Co. and Keeper’s Heart Whiskey in the market

· Create a consistent pre plan weekly to see minimum of 30 accounts in your geographical area

· Develop Keeper’s Heart with key, local, regional and national retail and on premise accounts within the region.

· Establish and maintain strong professional relationships directly with key distributors, trade professionals and key accounts in prioritized markets within territory.

· Execute brand training opportunities with local distributor sales reps.

· Work with distributor mixologists on brand specific cocktails that drive usage and visibility.

· Execute market plan, sales meetings and team meetings; responsible to provide education of Keeper’s Heart brand and promotions to key distributor personnel

· Track and analyze account visits set key account calls per week, distribution sell in, market pricing, promotional activity and incentives

· Assist head of sales in conducting business review and planning meetings with distributors

· Execute regular market surveys. Solo, with distributors and /or with OSDC team members.

· Utilize company systems, including expense reports, VIP Analytics and Karma, etc.

· Seek and pursue new opportunities to expand brand awareness, visibility, and distribution to drive sales of Keeper’s Heart

· Target all accounts for distribution

· Attend and present at distributor sales meetings and events

· Implement promotional opportunities via menu lists and drink features, displays, shelves and ads

· Identify and facilitate events within the assigned account list/market

· Schedule and conduct tastings and seminars

· Be point of contact for distillery visits from region visitors

· Follow up to ensure activations are fully executed as planned

· Collaborate with marketing to improve brand awareness

**Travel:**

At least 25%

**Requirements:**

· Bachelor’s degree required

· A minimum of 3+ years in wine & spirits sales roles, startup experience is preferred

· Affinity with spirits category and relevant experience working on similar spirits brands desired

· Strong knowledge of on and off-premise, retail environment required

· Experience with managing budgets, working in a fast-paced environment, creative problem-solving skills and stakeholder management

**What We Offer:**

Health and disability benefits, 10 paid holidays, paid time off, bonus structure based on business success

\\*\\*\\* NO AGENCIES

Job Type: Full-time

Application Question(s):

* A 3-year-old is building tall structures out of wooden blocks and then kicking them down. You've already reminded him that a wooden structure can't be taller than him and that he should take it down gently. He's not listening.

Which responses are appropriate? Select all that apply.  
A. Sit with him and if his structure gets too tall, redirect him to start building another  
B. Provide an opportunity to use soft blocks that can be built to any height  
C. Give him a five-minute time-out and ask him to use this time to calm down  
D. Tell him that a falling block hit you and pretend that you're crying because it hurt

title: Associate Director, Bio-Markers
description:
Eikon Therapeutics is a new biopharmaceutical company employing revolutionary technology at the intersection of chemistry, engineering, computation, and biology to discover novel treatments for life-threatening diseases. Eikon's discovery platform is built on groundbreaking innovations from its founders (Nobel Prize, 2014), culminating in the creation of microscopes which enable real time, molecular-resolution measurements of protein movement in living cells, thereby unlocking otherwise intractable classes of proteins as drug targets.

**Position**  

As the Associate Director, Bio-Markers, you will play a crucial role in driving the discovery and utilization of biomarkers for our groundbreaking biotechnology solutions. Collaborating closely with interdisciplinary teams, you will lead efforts to identify, validate, and interpret biomarkers, ultimately contributing to the development of novel diagnostic and therapeutic approaches. This role will require a minimum of 3 days a week of onsite presence (or more as business needs require) in either our New York or New Jersey office to ensure effective management, operational excellence and high-performance delivery of clinical studies and to support the expected significant team growth & collaboration.


**About You**  

The ideal candidate should demonstrate expertise in biomarker discovery, validation, and interpretation, possess a strong background in molecular biology, genomics, or proteomics, and be proficient in data analysis tools and bioinformatics. Additionally, they should have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, effective communication abilities, a passion for innovative research, and the ability to excel in a dynamic and interdisciplinary biotech environment.


**What You'll Do**


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute strategies for the identification and application of biomarkers in alignment with company goals.
* Contribute to efforts to identify and evaluate potential biomarkers through data analysis, experimentation, and advanced technology utilization.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including clinical, research, and regulatory to develop and implement biomarker plans, contribute to clinical protocols, writing ICFs for clinical trials.
* Contribute to CDx strategy and to execute the implementation of companion diagnostics (CDx) in support of clinical studies.
* Oversee the validation of biomarker assays through rigorous scientific methods, ensuring accurate and reliable results for downstream applications.
* Analyze complex biological and clinical data sets, extracting meaningful insights to inform biomarker selection and interpretation of clinical data.
* Foster collaborations with internal and external partners to leverage diverse expertise and advance clinical biomarker research.
* Contribute to the dissemination of research findings through publications, presentations, and engagement with the clinical teams as well as the scientific community.


**Qualifications**


* Post Graduate degree with 8+ years of relevant experience or a Bachelor' degree with 10+ years of relevant experience in a relevant field, such as Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, or a related discipline.
* Demonstrated experience in biomarker discovery, validation, and interpretation within a research or biotech setting.
* Strong background in molecular biology, genomics, biochemistry, immunology, cell biology, or other relevant biological disciplines.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools, bioinformatics, and statistical methods for biomarker analysis.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and draw meaningful conclusions.
* Effective communication skills for collaboration with diverse teams and presentation of findings.
* Passion for innovative research and technology integration in the pursuit of advancing biotechnology.
* Ability to excel in a dynamic, fast-paced, and interdisciplinary biotech environment.
* Experience developing companion diagnostics a plus.
* Experience leading biomarker oncology studies a plus.


At Eikon, employee compensation also includes bonus and equity compensation, in addition to several generous benefit programs, including:


* 401k plan with company matching
* Medical (premiums covered by Eikon at 95%), dental and vision insurance (premiums covered by Eikon at 100%)
* Mental health and wellness benefits
* Weeklong summer and winter holiday shutdowns
* Generous paid time off and holiday policies
* Life/AD&D Insurance (premiums covered by Eikon at 100%) and optional supplemental employee-paid life/AD&D policies
* Enhanced parental leave benefit
* Daily subsidized lunch program when on-site

The expected salary range for this role is $165,000 to $180,500 depending on skills, competency, and the market demand for your expertise.


Eikon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment.



In accordance with the Company's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace, the Company requires all employees to be Fully Vaccinated with one of the FDA approved COVID-19 vaccines, which includes those vaccines that have received the FDA's emergency use authorization. You will be expected to be Fully Vaccinated as of your Start Date. If you believe that you are exempt from this requirement under an applicable law or regulations, including Americans with Disabilities Act and California's Fair Employment and Housing Act, you will need to contact the Company's Human Resources group. For purposes of this section, Fully Vaccinated means (i) the completion of the vaccination regimen as approved by the FDA (by way of example, 2 doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine and 1 dose of the Johnson and Johnson vaccine), and (ii) timely receiving booster vaccination, as recommended by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.



We are currently not accepting any new third-party agencies or firms at this time. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website, employees or Human Resources. Eikon Therapeutics will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm associated with unsolicited resumes.

title: Part Time Sales Associate
description:
**Company Description**  

As the global leader in health and wellness innovation since 1935, GNC motivates people to reach their goals with the most trusted and exciting selection of products in the industry.


As #TeamGNC, we work hard to ensure that our consumers come first. We are always cultivating and collaborating on new ideas to bring innovative solutions to the forefront and testing new solutions to translate goals into action. Our team members are advocates for change and innovation.


There is no greater gift than good health and no greater satisfaction than helping others to achieve it. Be a part of helping others to Live Well!

 **Job Description**  

GNC is looking for dynamic sales associates that not only “Live Well” as a lifestyle, but have the desire to share that passion with others. If that describes you, then join the high energy store’s team at GNC. This outstanding opportunity is designed to help you reach your full earning potential. In addition to your base pay, you have the ability to earn additional cash through our sales incentive program!


If you are career minded, this opportunity provides you with the perfect springboard to full-time or managerial positions.


What are we looking for?

* A Sales Associate who enjoys interacting with customers and is committed to helping them choose the right products, as well as making recommendations based on your overall product knowledge and understanding of their needs
* The ability for you to generate sales, not only for the benefit to the company and your store, but for you and your financial well-being.
* The drive to achieve and exceed personal sales and productivity goals
* Promote career growth by working with store management in the opening, closing and operating of a retail store. This includes cash handling, inventory count and deposits according to GNC procedures, as well as maintaining the appearance of the store
* The ability to complete omni-channel orders timely and accurately in compliance with company guidelines.
* Display an awareness of all store communications including: product information, advertising, promotions and other marketing initiatives
* Boost product knowledge by learning the features, advantages and benefits. Staying on top of nutritional, wellness

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma or equivalent preferred
* Passion to *Live Well!*
* Self-motivated
* Strong communication and team building skills
* Ability to work a flexible schedule (i.e. Holidays, weekends)
* Must be at least 18 years of age

**Benefits**

The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

* Access to GNC Health Program (virtual health services)
* Competitive rate of pay
* Employee discount
* This position is eligible to participate in the Individual Sales Commission Program

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

*Base Hourly Rate: $16.00 to $16.00 per hour*  

  

*The base hourly rate range represents the low and high end of the anticipated hourly rate range. The actual hourly rate offered for this position depends on several factors including knowledge, skills, experience, and location. Our base hourly rate is one component of GNC’s competitive total rewards strategy.*

The compensation and benefits information are accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.


GNC Holdings, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer


GNC Holdings LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Cannabis Courier Delivery Driver
description:
**Company Overview:**

DirectLeaf Delivery, LLC is a licensed Class 6 delivery startup, dedicated to providing high-quality and safe products to our valued customers. We pride ourselves on exceptional customer service, strict adherence to legal standards, and fostering a welcoming and inclusive work environment.

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a responsible and reliable Cannabis Courier Delivery Driver to join our team. As a Delivery Driver, you will be responsible for ensuring the timely, accurate, and safe delivery of cannabis products from the licensed dispensary operator to our customers. You will play a crucial role in maintaining our reputation for exceptional customer service and compliance with all state and local regulations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Safely and efficiently deliver cannabis products to customers within the designated delivery area.
* Provide excellent customer service, ensuring a positive experience for all customers.
* Verify customer identification and ensure compliance with all state and local regulations.
* Verify customer age and process cashless transactions and maintain accurate delivery records.
* Perform vehicle maintenance checks to ensure the safety and reliability of your vehicle.
* Communicate effectively with dispatchers and management to ensure smooth delivery operations.
* Maintain a clean and organized vehicle.

**Qualifications:**

* Must be at least 25 years old.
* Possess a valid driver's license and a clean motor vehicle driving record.
* Own a reliable vehicle with current registration and insurance. (Include a 10-year age limit on vehicles.)
* Willingness to undergo a background check.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Strong customer service and communication skills.
* Ability to navigate a driver dashboard mobile applications.
* Familiarity with local delivery areas and routes.
* Must be punctual, reliable, and trustworthy.
* Previous delivery experience is preferred but not required.
* Veterans are encouraged to apply!

**Benefits:**

* Competitive pay with potential for tips.
* Flexible scheduling options.
* Supportive and inclusive work environment.

**How to Apply:** If you meet the qualifications and are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume outlining your relevant experience and why you would be a great fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you! Veterans are encouraged to apply!

DirectLeaf Delivery, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

title: Chef
description:
Chef for Productions

Our company is hired directly by our clients to provide catering services in the Movie and Film industry.

We are seeking an experienced and skilled Chef to join our culinary team. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and preparing meals in a fast-paced on the go food trucks environment stationed in film productions. The ideal candidate will have a passion for food, excellent cooking skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team.

The ability to work under pressure and work directly with management to create and deliver high-quality, nutritious, and attractive selection of meals.

The Production Chef will accurately and efficiently prepare, cook, and present a variety of hot and/or cold food items for various meal periods: to include Breakfast and lunch or Lunch and dinner.

Skills:  
- Proven experience in the food service industry, preferably in a restaurant or catering setting.  
- Strong knowledge of culinary techniques, ingredients, and kitchen operations.  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead and motivate a team.  
- Familiarity with local food industry standards and regulations.  
- A passion for creating innovative and delicious dishes that meet the needs of a diverse range of customers.  
- Ability to help with food service management and catering services.  
- Experience with team management and a strong commitment to providing exceptional customer service.

* The ability to prioritise efficiently
* initiative and problem-solving ability
* physical stamina and resilience
* the ability to work with a range of people (including actors, directors and caterers, among others)
* the ability to remain calm and perform well under pressure

Responsibilities :

Manage the day-to-day operations of the kitchen, including food preparation, inventory management, and ordering supplies.  
- Develop and implement menus for special events and catering services.  
- Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety standards.  
- Assist with food service management, including managing the amount of dishes distributed.  
- Provide exceptional customer service, ensuring that all customers receive a positive experience  
- Collaborate with management team to achieve high-quality standards and consistency in food preparation.  
- Participate in menu planning and contribute to the development of new recipes and dishes.

* Prepare food for a crew of at least 100 or more.
* Create a daily list of inventory needed and work in liaison with the Key employee in order to ensure the proper inventory is always at hand.
* Pick up company truck and drive to production each day and return truck (travel time is compensated)
* Must have a valid driver’s license
* Willing to work over time is a must up to 12- 14 hours a day, if needed.
* Working hours tend to be long and unpredictable, often up to six days a week during production. Broadcasting is a 24-hour operation, and the working style reflects this.

Compensation

Hourly $25.00 an hour

Paid overtime

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 – 60 per week

Experience:

* Cooking: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: On the road

description:
Brooklyn Family Orthodontics is looking for some **part time** help on **Mondays**. We may also have Wednesdays available for the right person. This is a position that has room to grow for the right person with the right personality. If you are unfamiliar with orthodontics, but you have the qualities we are looking for, we are willing to train you! Please send a resume through **Indeed.com** and briefly introduce yourself.

title: Territory Account Manager
description:
**EquipmentShare is Hiring a Territory Account Manager**
--------------------------------------------------------



EquipmentShare is searching for a **Territory Account Manager** for our Core Solutions rental location in South Plainfield, NJ to be responsible for expanding our existing customer base by building relationships with contractors and construction company principals. Core Solutions branches offer equipment rentals including aerial equipment, earth moving equipment, material handling equipment and more.


**Pay:** $70,000 - $200,00+ (Base + uncapped commission with no market restrictions)


**Why We're a Better Place to Work**
------------------------------------


* Competitive pay: Base salary plus uncapped commission
* Commission guarantee period while building book of business
* Company provided truck or Vehicle allowance ($800/mo)
* Company provided cell phone or phone stipend
* Relocation assistance
* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits coverage for full-time employees
* 401(k) and company match
* Generous paid time off (PTO) plus company paid holidays
* Fitness Membership stipends plus seasonal and year round wellness challenges.
* Company sponsored events (annual family gatherings, food truck nights and more). Monthly family dinner nights
* Volunteering and local charity initiatives that help you nurture and grow the communities you call home. Employees receive 16 hours of paid volunteer time per year.
* Opportunities for career advancement and professional development

### **Primary Responsibilities**


* Quickly respond to inbound leads and requests
* Expand our existing customer base by building relationships with contractors and construction company principals. Tell them about the numerous ways EquipmentShare can help save them money, make more money and operate more efficiently. In other words, educate them on how EquipmentShare solves their problems!
* Maintain and nurture existing customer relationships to ensure our customers are 100 percent satisfied with the level of service and support they receive from EquipmentShare. Keep them up-to-date about new or additional ways in which EquipmentShare can help improve their business.
* Promptly respond to and resolve customer inquiries, requests, complaints or other communications.
* Develop new sales strategies and techniques to increase our market share and improve our customer experience.

### **Skills & Qualifications**


* First and foremost, we're looking for someone who's tenacious and innovative and possesses superior sales skills
* Industry knowledge (rental or construction) and experience in B2B is sales preferred, but not required (if you're a born salesperson, we'll train you on what you need to know and how to win more business)
* You have strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills
* You can adapt to the fast pace of a growing company and stay continuously educated on the latest EquipmentShare products and services
* You're competitive but thrive in a team-oriented environment

EquipmentShare is an EOE M/F/D/V

title: Client Partner, CPG Uber Advertising
description:
**About the Role**
  

  

The team is looking for a strategic seller to be a founding member of our newly formed Uber Ads division. As a Sr Client Partner, you will be responsible for building mutually beneficial ads partnerships with CPG partners. You will lead the ads sales strategy for a portfolio of top/mid-tail CPG brands and drive adoption of an expanding suite of ads offerings across our Mobility and Delivery platforms. You will work closely with cross functional partners tp consistently deliver on our partners needs. You will report to the Head of Food & Beverage, Uber Advertising.
  

  

**What You'll Do**
* Partner with cross functional teams to develop and execute ads partnership strategies that deliver on your CPG partners' needs and exceed quarterly growth goals
* Build relationships with Director, VP and C-level marketing executives and key marketing decision makers within partner organizations
* Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills to navigate relationships and difficult partner conversations.
* Be an indispensable cross-functional partner across Product, Marketing and Operations team ensure we are delivering on partner needs.
* Expand ads product adoption. Clearly communicate the value of our newest ads products with a lens of creativity to differentiate our offering

**Basic Qualifications**
* 4+ years' experience in end-to-end Enterprise / Large Customer Digital Advertising Sales
* Experience selling ads solutions to large, complex brands or organizations

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience selling into large CPG brands, with a specific focus in digital advertising
* Ability to build and implement strategic sales plans that result in success for our partners and Uber
* Excellent negotiation and problem solving skills
* Creative storytelling experience with the ability to use data to quantify opportunities and influence decision makers
* Strong leadership ability
Speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter mentality. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and navigating ambiguity  
* 

  

  

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$100,000 per year - USD$111,000 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$111,000 per year - USD$123,000 per year. title: Group Product Manager, Merchant Growth
description:
**About the Role**
  

  

The Uber Eats team is dedicated to the mission of making eating well effortless every day for everyone. With Uber speed, professional delivery partners, and partnerships with the world's best-loved restaurants, we are bringing convenience and happiness to people one meal at a time.
  

  

The Merchant team is responsible for the success of restaurants in the Uber Eats marketplace, allowing them to be the best version of themselves and be successful in attracting new eaters, providing a great hospitality experience, and having repeat business.
  

  

**What the Candidate Will Do**  

  

As the head of Merchant Growth, you'll be responsible for a variety of projects, through the lifecycle of the merchant to help merchants be more successful in the marketplace. You'll work closely with product managers on your team, engineering, design, data science, and business partners to identify opportunities to help merchants take steps that would make them more successful, and, as a result, make the the Uber Eats marketplace more successful as a result.
  

  

This is a very high potential role; Merchant Growth can have a dramatic impact on our restaurant selection and therefore our success in the marketplace. You will develop and execute experiments to test early concepts in order to learn quickly.
  

  

**Basic Qualifications**Minimum 10+ years of product management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them * - and you're deeply proud of what you've accomplished.
* Experience with UIs and UX experiments and in working with designers & data science.
* STEM undergraduate degree or equivalent.

**Preferred Qualifications*** Prior experience with SMB and Enterprise and in a multi-sided Marketplace.
* Passionate about building businesses, not features. Entrepreneurial experience building and leading businesses, including ownership and optimization of business performance metrics.
You tackle complex product challenges and simplify them to avoid making them our users' and partner's problems.  
* 

  

  

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$239,000 per year - USD$265,500 per year. title: Territory Manager, Medical Dermatology- Central Los Angeles, CA-
description:
**Title:** **Territory Manager, Medical Dermatology- Central Los Angeles, CA-**
===============================================================================

Date: Sep 10, 2024
Location: Sun - Remote
Company: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, Inc (USA)
**JOB TITLE: Territory Manager, Medical Dermatology**

  


**OBJECTIVES****:**


The Sun Medical Dermatology Territory Manager is responsible for promoting Sun’s branded dermatology portfolio and optimizing the business opportunities in targeted physician offices, key clinics and institutions that specialize in the area of medical dermatology. The Territory Manager will be required to demonstrate excellence in developing and implementing territory business plans that lead to achievement of sales goals and objectives. Responsibilities include coordination and integration with the HQ Commercial Team (Marketing, etc.) and field based employees (Field Reimbursement Managers, etc.) to effectively drive acceptance of promoted products within a designated business area and geography.


**Required****:**


* Bachelor Degree
* Pharmaceutical and/or Medical Device sales experience
* Strong communication skills and business acumen
* Ability to collaborate, innovate, adapt and deliver results
* Valid driver’s license


**Preferred****:**


* 5+ years pharmaceutical sales experience
* 3+ years medical dermatology sales experience
* Experience selling products in a complex Market Access environment
* Experience promoting high-science products
* Product launch experience
* Experience selling in a highly competitive environment


**PERSONAL SKILLS/ATTRIBUTES****:**


This individual must have a positive attitude and be adaptable to a dynamic environment while maintaining focus on achieving territory business goals. This individual should be highly motivated and highly professional. Capable of building trust with their matrix team and transparent, ethical and compliant in all their activities. They should be proficient at selling and presenting detailed scientific subject matter in a clear and understandable fashion.


Sun Dermatology is committed to building a ***best-in-class commercial team*** of passionate, ethical and credible professionals who are committed to winning the right way and are accountable to their assigned objectives. We will focus on supporting our customers to the best of our ability ensuring that the interests of patients remain at the forefront of all we do.

  


**GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES/DECISION MAKING AUTHORITY****:**


* Reports directly to the Regional Sales Manager
* Responsible for the understanding and leveraging CRM, sales data, and reports
* Responsible for timely call reporting and expense reporting
* Responsible for managing promotional budgets within their territory
* Responsible for meeting monthly, quarterly and annual sales goals

  




**SUPERVISION RECEIVED****:** Reports to Regional Sales Manager


**INTERACTIONS WITH OTHERS:** Interacts at multiple levels inside and outside the company. Tact, diplomacy, and a high level of professionalism are essential.

title: Lead Dental Treatment Coordinator
description:
Description:

Join Connecticut's premier doctor led multi-specialty group practice, where we deliver patient-centric care with compassion and respect. Committed to exceeding expectations, we proactively seize every opportunity to elevate the patient experience and enhance clinical outcomes.


At Darien Dental Associates we embody our core values of respect, quality care, and compassion daily, striving to fulfill our mission of fostering the highest quality care for all patients. Our company culture guides our success, which is at the core of everything we do.


The Treatment Coordinator is a liaison between the doctor and the patient. They provide a calm and warm environment for patients who are otherwise anxious and concerned about how to afford dentistry. They prepare financial estimates from treatment recommended by the doctor and present financials to patients in a calm and professional manner. They are knowledgeable about the treatment and timelines, the doctor’s schedule, and they are prepared to negotiate financial arrangements with the clients.

**What we offer:**

* A comprehensive benefits package, competitive pay, opportunity to work with an experienced, enthusiastic, and organized team!

**Specific job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Greet and check in patients
* Audit patient charts to ensure patient forms are complete and up to date
* Evaluate patient insurance plans to ensure eligibility, accuracy, and coverage percentages
* Discuss treatment needs with patients
* Estimate patient out of pockets for treatment, collect & post payments
* Evaluate patient charts to properly schedule appointments with providers, as indicated by clinical notes
* Contact existing patients to schedule incomplete treatment plans
* Evaluate schedule to identify new patients, verify that all necessary information has been received from the prior provider’s office, verify completion status of new patient forms.
* Handle heavy phone volume
* Act as a liaison between patients & doctors
* General office duties (printing/faxing/computer data entry, etc.)


Requirements:
* Superior customer service skills, with the ability to infuse personality, empathy, and enthusiasm into each patient contact
* Dental business office experience **(5+ years)**
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
* Excellent computer skills, Dentrix Ascend experience is a plus
* Willingness to learn and grow
* A desire to become part of our family-oriented team & support our mission to deliver the best patient experience possible!

**Benefits**

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Employee (and family!) dental plan
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan


At Darien Dental Associates, an office supported by Archway Dental Partners, we’re committed to supporting you. We’re a supportive collective of outstanding practices with dental excellence as our keystone. We stand for the wellbeing of our providers and patients. Our clinical teams and support system collaborate for the greater good. You’re welcome here. Apply today to learn more and get connected with us.


#DACT1
company_description: Dental Associates of Connecticut has been providing state-of-the-art dental care to families in Connecticut since 1971. We welcome you to join the team, and the family!

title: Head Chef
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a skilled and creative Head Chef to join our team. The Head Chef will be responsible for overseeing all culinary activities in our restaurant, ensuring high-quality dishes are served on time. The ideal candidate should have a passion for food and excellent leadership skills to inspire and mentor the kitchen staff.

**Responsibilities**  
- Plan and direct food preparation and culinary activities  
- Create innovative menu items while maintaining traditional favorites  
- Supervise kitchen staff, including training, scheduling, and performance management  
- Ensure compliance with food safety regulations and quality standards  
- Manage inventory levels and control food costs  
- Collaborate with the management team to develop seasonal menus and specials  
- Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment

**Requirements**  
- Proven experience as a Head Chef or Executive Chef in a fine dining restaurant  
- Strong knowledge of various cooking methods, ingredients, equipment, and procedures  
- Excellent leadership and communication skills  
- Ability to manage a fast-paced kitchen environment efficiently  
- Understanding of inventory management and cost control principles  
- Degree in Culinary Arts or relevant field is preferred  
- Certification in food safety and sanitation practices

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $118,520.00 per year

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10018 (Required)

Work Location: In person
